articles.author: Mohammad Salem, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military took control of the vital Rafah border crossing between Gaza and Egypt on Tuesday, pushing into the southern Gazan town after a night of air strikes and as prospects for a ceasefire deal hung in the balance.
articles.title: Israeli military takes control of vital Rafah crossing from Gaza into Egypt

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Rumbling out of its forest hideout, the hulking German-supplied howitzer has only a few minutes to fire before slipping back under cover to evade Russian surveillance in the skies above.
articles.title: Fire and hide: Ukraine's artillery pinned down by Russian drones

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin was sworn in for a new six-year term on Tuesday at a Kremlin ceremony that was boycotted by the United States and a number of other Western countries due to Russia's war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia's Vladimir Putin sworn in as president for a fifth term

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, David Gauthier-Villars
articles.description: Ukrainian state prosecutors say they have examined debris from 21 of around 50 North Korean ballistic missiles launched by Russia between late December and late February, as they seek to assess the threat from Moscow's cooperation with Pyongyang.
articles.title: Exclusive: Ukraine examines N.Korean missile debris amid fears of Moscow-Pyongyang axis

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, James Oliphant
articles.description: When U.S. President Joe Biden arrives at the U.S. Capitol on Tuesday to honor 6 million Jews killed eight decades ago, his message will be as much about the present as the past.
articles.title: Biden to condemn antisemitism, praise free speech at Holocaust remembrance
Payments in focus as prosecutors make their case in Trump hush money trial

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron welcomes Chinese President Xi Jinping in the Pyrenees mountains on Tuesday, for the second day of a trip during which Xi showed little sign of being ready to offer major concessions on trade or foreign policy.
articles.title: Macron seeks to charm Xi into trade concessions in Pyrenees jaunt

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine have accused each other at the global chemical weapons watchdog in The Hague of using banned toxins on the battlefield, the organisation said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia, Ukraine trade allegations of chemical weapons use at global watchdog

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: In the jungles of southeastern Myanmar's Dawna Hills, rebels from an armed ethnic group are fighting to hold back columns of reinforcements sent by the country's ruling junta to try to reclaim Myawaddy, a critical trading outpost on the Thai border.
articles.title: In Myanmar war, crucial window looms for junta and rebels

articles.author: Rupam Jain, Tora Agarwala
articles.description: As India votes in a six-week general election, Narendra Modi's image adorns everything from packs of rice handed out to the poor to large posters in cities and towns.
articles.title: India election: Inside Modi and BJP's plan to win a supermajority
